main event: On 25th September 1954 in Lafayette, Louisiana, 3 unknown round orange objects were observed following a straight flight path parallel to the horizon, ultimately believed to be meteors.
interesting points: The objects were reported as round and orange in color, and were observed by a civilian on the ground as well as military personnel in flight.
The sighting took place at night, with no physical evidence or photographs of the objects.
The observation was made by multiple observers, and the objects were tracked at various altitudes with unknown speeds.
Military officials concluded the sighting to be meteors, although the exact nature of the objects remained unknown.
Weather conditions, including wind speeds and cloud cover, were documented at the time and location of the sighting.
sighted object: three unknown round orange objects following a straight flight path parallel to the horizon
